name: Subfinder
description: Fast subdomain enumeration tool using passive sources
documentation: Subfinder is a subdomain discovery tool that discovers valid subdomains using passive online sources.

inputs.label: Target Domain
inputs.description: The root domain to enumerate (e.g., example.com)

parameters.label: Data Sources
parameters.description: Specific sources to use for discovery (-s flag). Leave empty to use default sources.
parameters.helpText: Select specific sources or choose 'All Sources' for comprehensive enumeration

parameters.label: Exclude Sources
parameters.description: Sources to exclude from enumeration (-es flag)
parameters.helpText: Useful to skip sources that require API keys or are slow

parameters.label: Recursive Mode
parameters.description: Use only sources that can handle subdomains recursively (-recursive flag)

parameters.label: Timeout (seconds)
parameters.description: Seconds to wait before timing out (-timeout flag)

parameters.label: Max Time (minutes)
parameters.description: Minutes to wait for enumeration results (-max-time flag)

parameters.label: Concurrent Threads
parameters.description: Number of concurrent goroutines for resolving (-t flag, requires -active)

parameters.label: Rate Limit (requests/sec)
parameters.description: Maximum number of HTTP requests to send per second (-rl flag)

parameters.label: Collect Sources
parameters.description: Include all sources in the output (-cs flag, JSON only)

parameters.label: Include IP Addresses
parameters.description: Include host IP in output (-oI flag, requires -active)

parameters.label: Silent Mode
parameters.description: Show only subdomains in output (-silent flag)

parameters.label: Custom CLI Options
parameters.description: Additional custom options (one per line). These will be appended to the command.
parameters.helpText: Enter any additional subfinder flags not covered above. Example: -proxy, -r, -match, -filter, etc.
